## Accessibility statement

We’re committed to making beta.parliament.uk accessible to all users, regardless of browsing technology (such as text-only web browsers), disability, or access requirements. 
We review our accessibility throughout development and we aim to meet level AA of the [Web Content Accessibility Guidelines](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20/) (WCAG 2.0).

## Compatible tools
The [Digital Accessibility Centre](http://www.digitalaccessibilitycentre.org/) work with us to test a range of assistive technology and access needs on selected pages across our site. The tools and systems below were last tested in February 2018.

### Desktop tools
- JAWS 15 or above with Internet Explorer 11
- NVDA with Firefox
- Dragon Naturally Speaking 12 or above with Internet Explorer 
- navigation without a mouse using Chrome
- ZoomText 10 or above with Internet Explorer

### iPad and iPhone tools
- VoiceOver with Safari on iPhone
- Zoom with Safari on iPad
- TalkBack on Android

### Access needs
The centre also tested different access needs with users who don’t use assistive technology. These tests were done on Chrome and Safari with a range of participants, including users:
- who are Deaf 
- who are dyslexic
- who are colour blind
- with learning disabilities
- with Asperger syndrome
- with anxiety/panic disorder

## Send us your feedback
We’re constantly trying to improve beta.parliament.uk. If you have trouble using our site or have suggestions for improving accessibility, please [contact us](mailto:websitebeta@parliament.uk?subject=Accessibility%20feedback) with your feedback.

## Accessibility help

If you’re having trouble adapting your computer, visit [AbilityNet](https://www.abilitynet.org.uk/) for guidance on your accessibility needs. The site shows you how to:
- [make your mouse easier to use](https://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/making-your-mouse-easier-to-use/)
- [use keyboard shortcuts instead of a mouse](https://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/category/keyboard-shortcuts/)
- [talk to your device](https://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/talking-to-your-device/)
- [get your device to read content](https://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/category/making-your-mobile-or-tablet-talk/)
- [make text larger](https://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/making-text-larger/)
- [change text and background colours](https://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/changing-your-colours/)
- [magnify the screen](https://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/magnifying-the-screen/)
